text: was a after Tenbun and before Eiroku. This period started in October 1555 and ended in February 1558.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kōji" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 545. During this time, the emperors were Nussbaum, "Go-Nara," p. 257. and .Nussbaum, "Ōgimachi Tennō," p. 739; Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 372-382. ==Events of the Kōji era== * 1555 (Kōji 1, 1st month): A border war between daimyos of Aki Province and Suō Province.Titsingh, p. 382. * 1555 (Kōji 1, 11th month): Mōri MotonariNussbaum, "Mōri Motonari" at p. 660. won the , also known as the "Battle of Miyajima"Miyajima Tourist Association, "History of Miyajima" ; Museum of Fine Arts (MFA), The Great Battle at Miyajima (Miyajima ôgassen no zu), woodblock print, c. 1865; retrieved 2012-4-27. * 1555 (Kōji 1): Battle of Kawanakajima.Sansom, George Bailey. (1961) A History of Japan, 1334-1615, p. 246. * 1556 (Kōji 2): The Ōmori silver mine controlled by the Mori clan.Sansom, p. 257. * 27 September 1557 (Kōji 3, 5th day of the 9th month): Emperor Go-Nara died at age 62.Titsingh, p. 382; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō): 後奈良天皇 (105) ==Related pages== * Muromachi period * Kōji (Heian period) == References == == Other websites == * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Kōji 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 1555 1556 1557 1558 Preceded by: Tenbun Era or nengō: Kōji Succeeded by: Eiroku Category:Japanese eras
title: Kōji (Muromachi period)
